results.title: Prayer for fame
results.creator_credit: Angela Josifoska, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Angela Josifoska, a teenager living in Melbourne’s western suburbs, tells of her quest for fame. She shares her early youth and the things that interested her throughout her life, culminating in a passion for performance. She candidly shares her dreams and ambitions for the future and her determination to succeed shines through.

results.title: One past eight futures "The making of"
results.brief_description: This mini-documentary takes us behind the scenes of the ‘One past eight futures’ Digital Storytelling workshop at ACMI. The participants of this particular workshop are eight young indigenous people who are part of the Indigenous Youth Leadership program. They discuss their stories, their participation in the workshop and what they have gained from the experience. The results are a social and cultural snapshot of Australia’s Indigenous youth, through their stories, their ties to the past and, mostly, their hopes for the future.

results.title: Change!
results.creator_credit: Tori Towney, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Tori Towney came from an encouraging and supportive family. Growing up, she resisted the urge to join her friends drinking and instead listened to the stories of her father, of his harsh and poor upbringing. When her mum encouraged her to move to Sydney and take up a scholarship at St Catherine’s, she grabbed this opportunity with both hands. Tori candidly shares what it was like to be away from home with no support network and how she overcame that and adapted to her new and exciting environment.

results.title: My tree
results.creator_credit: Kamsani Bin Salleh, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Families are always moving forward and tend to rarely dwell on the past. However, its important for Kamsani Bin Salleh to find out about his family history, for a greater sense of who he is, if nothing else. As he trawls his family history, he discovers the vast array of cultures that have contributed to his existence.

results.title: Dreaming in motion picture
results.creator_credit: Ian RT Colless, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Through music and footage of dance, Ian Colless weaves a tale, of his upbringing as a Gundungurra man, his home in the Blue Mountains and the journey to becoming a dancer. Ian has found a way to combine the various cultures and identities within him through dance, making his body a symbol of reconciliation and giving his people a voice.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ian RT Colless, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Anthony Lucas talks about 'The Cabinet of Anthony Lucas: The Faulty Fandangle'
results.creator_credit: Jason White, Csilla Csongvay and ACMI
results.brief_description: Oscar nominated animator Anthony Lucas (‘The Mysterious Geographic Explorations of Jasper Morello’) speaks candidly about his creative processes and inspirations. He introduces his latest work, ‘The Cabinet of Anthony Lucas: The Faulty Fandangle’, commissioned for ACMI’s ‘Screen Worlds’ exhibition. He takes us on a creative adventure from beginning to end, starting with initial ideas and inspiration, right through to the creation of the on-screen animation and mechanised components.

results.title: Ngay Wandabaa (My Spirit)
results.creator_credit: Ian Brown, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: ‘Ian Brown’ dedicates this Digital Story to his family and friends. He illustrates his life through the contributions and sacrifices made by the people closest to him, the encouragement of his parents, support of his sisters and sense of fraternity that he found with his friends when at school on his scholarship.

results.title: Michael Connor: in conversation with Conrad Bodman

video_links.name: Michael Connor: in conversation with Conrad Bodman

results.brief_description: Michael Connor, Consultant Curator of ‘Screen Worlds: The Story of Film, Television and Digital Culture’, is in conversation with Conrad Bodman, ACMI’s Head of Exhibitions. Connor discusses both the overall concept and the separate sections of the exhibition. Connor and Bodman discuss some of the challenges of choosing, sourcing and exhibiting over a hundred years of creative work and technology relating to the moving image.
results.title_for_label: Michael Connor: in conversation with Conrad Bodman
results.description: Michael Connor, Consultant Curator of ‘Screen Worlds: The Story of Film, Television and Digital Culture’, is in conversation with Conrad Bodman, ACMI’s Head of Exhibitions. results.title: Screen Worlds opening : September 2009
results.brief_description:
On Thursday September 17, 2009 ACMI’s new permanent screen culture exhibition Screen Worlds, was officially launched. The red carpet, VIP event attracted world wide attention with the attendance of both internationally recognised and home grown guests and artists. Kicking off the formalities was ACMI’s Board President, John Thwaites, followed by ACMI Director Tony Sweeney, Oscar® Winning Actress Cate Blanchett, Victorian Arts Minister Lynne Kosky and Victorian Premier John Brumby.
Following this, the ribbon is cut and guests enter the exhibition for the first time.
